name: 疾病生態學甲
description: The emergence of many human and wildlife infectious diseases is the product of anthropogenic environmental change. Ecology, the study of environment-organism interactions, is insightful for the control and prevention of infectious diseases. This course will introduce the current knowledge on this rapidly advancing research field.
goals: A practice on writing and oral presentation
A practice on discussing scientific issues with colleagues
syllabus:
1.     Introduction: what is disease ecology, why care?

2.     Zoonoses (I)

3.     Zoonoses (II)

4.     Bats and zoonoses 

5.     Vector-borne diseases (I)

6.     Vector-borne diseases (II)

7.     Effects of diseases on wildlife hosts (I)

8.     Effects of diseases on wildlife hosts (II)

9.     Mid-term exam

10.   Host-pathogen interactions

11.   Epidemiological models

12.   Disease control

13.   Biodiversity & human health

14.   Effects of climate change on diseases

15.   Socio-economy and disease emergence

16.   Case studies in Taiwan

17.   Term oral presentation

18.   Final exam
